item.title: Social media's impact on Australian teenagers' wellbeing isn't black and white, new study finds
item.description: The findings of a newly released study have challenged one-size-fits-all rules and blanket bans, as the Australian government's social media ban for children under 16 has been in effect for over a month.

item.title: Police say 10 tennis courts' worth of poppies stolen in recent theft
item.description: Investigations are continuing into the theft of a large quantity of poppy capsules from a Tasmanian farm. Police have confirmed the harvested area equates to 10 tennis courts, or 2,500 square metres.

item.title: These 'walking' epaulette sharks can make and lay eggs without spending extra energy, scientists say
item.description: Known best for their ability to "walk" on the sand and coral where they usually live, new research shows epaulette sharks could also defy assumptions in other ways.

item.title: Queenaland Maroons captain Ali Brigginshaw calls time on Origin career to focus on Brisbane Broncos
item.description: Ali Brigginshaw announces she has played her last State of Origin game for Queensland as she looks to focus on one final NRLW season with Brisbane.

item.description: The mother of a woman who died of "mixed drug toxicity" is pushing for South Australia to implement penalties for those who do not call emergency services in a medical emergency.

item.title: No inquest to be held into deaths of workers killed by concrete slab at Eagle Farm racecourse in 2016
item.description: The family of the two men killed when a wall crushed them at the racecourse are disappointed there will be no inquiry into the events of the "terrible day".

item.title: Jim Chalmers defends 'professional' Fed boss Jerome Powell in face of Trump attacks
item.description: Treasurer Jim Chalmers defends US central bank boss Jerome Powell as professional and diligent after the Trump administration launched a criminal investigation into the Federal Reserve chair.

item.title: How climate change is making extreme rainfall events like the Great Ocean Road flooding more frequent and intense
item.description: When it comes to extreme rainfall, it's hard for climate scientists to say what's natural and what's caused by climate change, but they do know the most extreme events are dropping more rain, more often. This is why.

item.description: A Darwin construction worker has been "seriously injured" after an excavator bucket fell and hit him, with paramedics transporting the man to hospital.

item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.description: A NSW coroner has referred the death of a young worker to the AFP for further investigation.

item.description: A 47-year-old woman, her son-in-law and her father are granted bail after the AFP charges them, claiming they are allegedly involved in supplying illicit tobacco and vapes.

item.title: Donald Trump threatens tariffs on countries that oppose US Greenland takeover
item.description: The US president insists America needs to acquire the territory of NATO partner Denmark for national security reasons.

item.title: From Xinjiang to Tehran: Iran's unrest is shaping China's view of power and world order
item.description: Xi Jinping's ambition is to occupy a central position in a reshaped international system, not to lead a permanent grouping of sanctioned or crisis-prone states.

item.title: Iran, Israel and the US play rapidly shifting roles in the Middle East
item.description: Israel joining with other countries in the Middle East to press Donald Trump not to launch a military strike against a weakened Iran is something that would have seemed incomprehensible even a couple of years ago.

item.description: The anatomy of the Natimuk fire offers a glimpse into a new and faster kind of bushfire — and the growing vulnerability of communities as climate change fuels dangerous conditions.

item.title: British passport changes disrupt plans for reunions, sick relative visits and business trips
item.description: From February 25, dual citizens of the UK and Ireland will be required to enter the UK using a valid British or Irish passport, a change causing major headaches for dual citizens with imminent travel plans.

item.description: A prominent parenting expert says serious allegations made against one of Australia’s most renowned authors should spark difficult but important conversations in households across the country.

item.description: The Crown star Khalid Abdalla is in Australia to perform his play Nowhere at Sydney Festival, exploring his experience on the frontline of the Arab Spring in Egypt.

item.title: Olympic climber Campbell Harrison happy to carry weight of being an LGBTQI+ role model
item.description: Campbell Harrison was homophobically trolled in the lead-up to the Paris Olympics. It strengthened his conviction about the importance of visible queer role models in sport.

item.title: Unauthorised ski race planned for Lake Bonney despite national suspension

item.description: The Albanese government will separate laws tightening gun control from its proposed hate speech reforms after the omnibus bill failed to secure the support of the Coalition and the Greens.

item.description: Senegal's players storm off the pitch in furious protest of a refereeing decision late in the Africa Cup of Nations final, but then return to score an extra-time winner against Morocco.

item.title: Oxfam wants tougher tax on billionaires as wealth grows 'by half a million dollars a day'
item.description: Oxfam Australia is calling on the federal government to tax the super-rich to help tackle growing inequality, as billionaires grow their wealth by more than half a million a day on average.

item.title: Adam Walton reveals what it's like to play Carlos Alcaraz at Australian Open
item.description: As first-round opponents go, they do not come any tougher than Carlos Alcaraz, as Australia's Adam Walton found out.

item.title: Bondi victim Matilda's parents doubt hate laws will prevent future violence
item.description: In their first wide-ranging interview, the parents of 10-year-old Matilda, the youngest victim of the Bondi attack, say the federal government's hate laws offer little reassurance that another terror attack will be prevented.

item.title: Randa Abdel-Fattah's lawyer serves second concerns notice to SA premier
item.description: Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah says her lawyer has served a second concerns notice for defamation on South Australian Premier Peter Malinauskas.

item.title: Homes lost as Tooperang fire rips through scrub south of Adelaide
item.description: Devastated residents of a bushfire ground south of Adelaide are starting to count the cost of the damage, with at least two reporting their homes have been lost.

item.title: Man faces court charged with planting pipe bombs along Canberra footpaths
item.description: Damien Paul O'Brien was arrested in Gungahlin on Saturday night after officers attached to ACT Policing allegedly found items used to assemble pipe bombs during a search of his Belconnen home earlier in the day.

item.title: 'Extremely large' brief of evidence in murder case against Tanika Bromley
item.description: Hundreds of statements gathered in murder case against Tanika Bromley.

item.title: Labor identity Tim Picton dies three weeks after alleged Northbridge assault, family confirms
item.description: Former Labor strategist Tim Picton dies in hospital, weeks after he was allegedly assaulted outside a Perth nightclub.

item.title: Aerial vision shows extent of destruction from Chile wildfires
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Deadly Chile wildfires trigger state of catastrophe
item.description: Wildfires raging across central and southern Chile have left at least 18 people dead, scorched thousands of hectares of forest and destroyed hundreds of homes, local authorities say, as the South American country swelters under a heat wave.

item.title: Australian Open fans wait hours to enter Melbourne Park as Craig Tiley admits surprise over record crowds
item.description: Thousands of fans are forced to wait in queues for hours, even as Australian Open boss Craig Tiley promised extra resources to aid entry into Melbourne Park.

item.title: Perth's median house price surges through $1m million mark, new data finds
item.description: Domain's latest quarterly house price report has found the cost to buy a home increased by 9.9 per cent in the last quarter of 2025, to a median of $1,087,762.

item.title: House flooded with raw sewage still uninhabitable six months on
item.description: Six months on from a major sewage spill in Perth's south, one resident whose house was substantially damaged still has not been able to get the repairs he needs to move back in, blaming both the Water Corp and his insurance company for the delay.

item.title: Tensions over Greenland escalate as US threatens tariffs after European troop deployment
item.description: Tensions between the United States and Greenland's allies reach a new high, with threats of increasing tariffs after European troops were sent to the island.

item.title: Steve Smith focuses on reclaiming Australian T20 spot for Olympics
item.description: Steve Smith has lit up the Big Bash since returning to the Sydney Sixers, but concedes the ship has sailed for him to play in next month's T20 World Cup.

item.title: Young Sydney surfer uninjured after shark bites board at Dee Why Beach
item.description: Surf Life Saving NSW confirms a boy is unharmed after an encounter with a shark at Dee Why Beach just before lunchtime on Monday.

item.title: Roger Allers, co-director of The Lion King, dies aged 76
item.description: Roger Allers was known for working on various Disney films including The Lion King, The Little Mermaid and Aladdin.

item.title: Elphinstone Engineering director sentenced for interfering with Aboriginal relics
item.description: Graeme Elphinstone, the founder and director of Elphinstone Engineering, avoids conviction and is fined $12,000 for interfering with Aboriginal relics on his land on Tasmania's east coast.

item.title: Shooters 'anxious' as ACT government looks to reform 'outdated' gun laws
item.description: Professional and recreational shooters say they want to see extensive community consultation before any changes are made to the ACT's gun laws.

item.title: Storm Hunter wins at Australian Open after thinking her career was over
item.description: A ruptured Achilles tendon threatened to send Storm Hunter into retirement, but her perseverance pays off with a first-round victory in Melbourne.

item.title: Switzerland's Noemi Reugg powers home to defend Tour Down Under title
item.description: After being dropped on the first two ascents of a pivotal section of the final stage, Switzerland's Noemi Reugg fights back brilliantly to claim back-to-back Tour Down Under victories.

item.title: Petition asks Alice Springs Public Library to extend opening hours amid outback heat
item.description: In one of Australia's hottest towns, the library is an important air-conditioned public space offering a no-cost respite from burning summer temperatures.

item.title: Bondi survivor Ya'akov Tetleroyd lost his father and nearly his arm in Bondi Beach terrorism event. He forgives the gunmen
item.description: Ya'akov Tetleroyd's father died in the Bondi Beach shootings. He nearly lost his arm as a result of being shot, yet he told 7.30 in an exclusive interview that he forgives the gunmen.

item.title: WA is losing the tobacco wars as gangs target vape stores and cheap cigarettes flood market
item.description: Burnt out storefronts in Perth and regional cities are testament to the government's inability to control the illegal tobacco trade — and it's not clear when things will change, writes Keane Bourke.

item.title: Flooding in Kalumburu, in the Kimberley region
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Kalumburu on flood watch after heavy rain as tropical low has high chance of developing into cyclone
item.description: People living in Kalumburu, one of the most remote communities in Western Australia's far north, are being warned of rising river levels and floods, after heavy rain.

item.title: What has caused a 'smack' of jellyfish to wash up on Melbourne's eastern beaches?
item.description: Visitors to Melbourne's eastern beaches over the weekend were surprised to see an influx of crimson jellyfish bobbing in the water. One expert says a "perfect storm" of factors has brought them to the coastline.

item.title: Weekend deluge causes flooding in far-north WA
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Nicolas Cage shrine amid weird pranks at Mount Gambier deputy mayor's home
item.description: A Nicolas Cage-themed shrine is the latest of a series of celebrity-themed pranks that Mount Gambier's deputy mayor says have befallen his home in recent weeks.

item.title: Monday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Investigation into fatal light plane crash near Sale finds 'irregularities' at flight training school
item.description: An investigation finds risky flying behaviour, an amateur-built aeroplane's "design deficiencies" and issues at the pilot's flight school may have contributed to a fatal light aeroplane crash in Victoria in 2024.

item.title: Teenage boy dies of injuries at bottom of cliff near Jerrabomberra Waterhole
item.description: A member of the public tried to perform CPR on a teenage boy suffering serious injuries at the bottom of a cliff near Canberra, but he died at the scene.

item.title: Man critical after being bitten by a shark at North Steyne Beach in third incident in two days
item.description: A man in his 20s is in a critical condition after he sustained leg injuries in another shark attack at a Sydney beach.

item.title: Man faces court after 2kg of meth seized in Katherine roadside drug bust
item.description: A 22-year-old man has faced court after police allegedly found 2 kilograms of methamphetamine, along with large quantities of other drugs, during a traffic stop in Katherine last week.

item.title: Iranian official says verified deaths in Iran protests reach at least 5,000
item.description: The death toll includes about 500 security personnel and exceeds that of any other round of protest or unrest in Iran in decades.

item.title: Helicopter at North Steyne Beach after shark attack
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: What is it like to live and work in the Antarctic?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi to dissolve parliament and call snap election for February 8
item.description: Japanese Prime Minister ⁠Sanae Takaichi will ​dissolve parliament ‌on ‌Friday ‌and call a snap ​election for February 8 ⁠to seek voter backing ‌for her ​spending ​plans and ‍other ⁠policies.

item.title: Queensland government will refuse to support federal gun buyback legislation, ABC understands
item.description: The ABC understands Queensland will join the Northern Territory and Tasmania in rejecting a national gun buyback scheme.

item.title: Victim Tanya urges alleged Mullewa shooter Kenneth Giles to come home safe
item.description: In her first statement since she was shot through the hand on January 7, Tanya says she wants Kenneth Giles to know she wants him to return home.

item.title: Donald Trump links Greenland takeover threat to Nobel Peace Prize snub, amid tariffs row with Europe
item.description: President Donald Trump sends a text message to the Norwegian Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Støre saying he no longer feels obligated to think purely of peace.

item.title: Land council chair calls for block on appointment of incoming NT administrator David Connolly
item.description: Former Northern Territory Cattlemen’s Association president David Connolly is set to be sworn in as NT administrator next month, but the emergence of past social media posts have led to calls for his appointment to be blocked.

item.title: Philippines star Alexandra Eala sends Australian Open crowds into a frenzy
item.description: Alexandra Eala, ranked 49 in the world, attracts a crowd that virtually brought the Australian Open to a standstill.

item.title: Man critical after being bitten by a shark in Sydney
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Prince Harry's court battle against British tabloids reaches final chapter
item.description: Prince Harry has returned to court in London in his third and final attempt to tame the British tabloids through the legal system.

item.title: Deadly Pakistan shopping plaza fire death toll rises to 23
item.description: Pakistani firefighters began pulling bodies from the smouldering remains of a sprawling Karachi shopping mall on Monday where dozens of people remain missing.

item.title: What we know so far about Spain's fatal high-speed train crash
item.description: Spanish authorities have declared three days of mourning after two trains collided on a track south of Madrid, killing at least 40 people.

item.title: Italian fashion designer Valentino dies aged 93 in Rome
item.description: The fashion icon's creations were adored by Hollywood stars, royals and first ladies for his fail-safe red carpet designs.

item.title: EPA asks Victorians to check water quality before swimming in Port Phillip Bay
item.description: Victoria's Environment Protection Authority says people wanting to cool off at Port Phillip Bay beaches this summer should stay across its regular pollution updates.

item.title: Oak Tasmania issued $1.1m penalty over hundreds of NDIS compliance failures
item.description: Oak Tasmania admits to 474 compliance and reporting failures, as well as breaches that resulted in the hospitalisation of multiple NDIS clients.

item.title: Travel quiz, January 20: Which Australian state has the most wine regions?
item.description: Do you know where Marco Polo Airport is? And which is the biggest island in Australia?

item.title: How lifting gave me back the power to feel good at sport
item.description: As a child, Julie "wasn't one of the sporty kids". A safe gym environment and then a supportive powerlifting community helped her realise that wasn't actually true.

item.title: Labor and Coalition on path to deal on hate laws reform as parliament deadline looms
item.description: Liberal MPs gathered to discuss the draft laws at a partyroom meeting in Canberra on Monday evening after Opposition Leader Sussan Ley and Prime Minister Anthony Albanese met to hash out an agreement.

item.title: China ramps up crackdown on Christians amid global political pressures
item.description: Dozens of church leaders and members have been arrested in China in recent months, which advocates say is indicative of intensifying persecution.

item.title: China's population declines for a fourth straight year amid record low birth rates
item.description: National data shows that in 2025, China's population shrunk by 3.39 million people, as experts warn the trend is likely to continue.

item.title: Donald Trump heading to Davos as bond market vigilantes plot against him
item.description: There are signs Donald Trump's bold strategy to artificially lower interest rates could backfire, as a level of disquiet emerges on money markets, particularly in bonds.

item.title: Shark expert says it's a 'terrible idea' to swim in Sydney Harbour after heavy rain
item.description: A public policy shark expert says sewage leaking into the harbour after heavy rainfall is attracting bait fish followed by sharks.

item.title: First Nations employee asked by supervisor about eating ants takes transport department to court
item.description: A First Nations employee at South Australia's Department for Infrastructure and Transport (DIT) has claimed she was sexually harassed by her supervisor and racially discriminated against when asked about eating ants before a cultural training session, court documents reveal.

item.title: In Iran, Elon Musk's Starlink helped citizens get messages beyond the 'digital prison'
item.description: In Iran, Starlink has provided a line to the outside world, but now there are fears about such vital technology being in the hands of one company.

item.title: New Trump tariffs on European allies could push EU to use 'trade bazooka'
item.description: Following the Trump administration's recent tariff threat on European allies, some experts warn it may push Europe closer to China, and potentially see the European Union use its anti-coercion instrument, also known as a "trade bazooka", in response.

item.title: Victorian bushfires squeeze beekeeper access to high-quality trees for bees ahead of winter
item.description: Apiarists in Victoria are wondering how they will keep their bees fed during winter after bushfires two years in a row render certain areas inaccessible.

item.title: Dissecting Donald Trump's Greenland message, line by line
item.description: A leaked message from the US president to Norway's prime minister has fanned the flames of a geopolitical dumpster fire engulfing Greenland. We've analysed Donald Trump's claims to see if they stack up.

item.title: Women's captain departs football club after men's offensive Silly Saturday costumes
item.description: A women's senior football captain has stepped away from her local club after photos of the senior men's leadership team were posted online during their "Silly Saturday" post-season celebrations.

item.title: Stan Wawrinka's impressive win, a wheelchair exit and Alja Tomljanović tells off her dad — quick hits from the Australian Open
item.description: One player had to be wheeled off the courts in a wheelchair, while Alja Tomljanović was wishing her dad would be quiet in the crowd. Here are the quick hits from the Australian Open.

item.title: Ipswich residents frustrated as nickel waste stored near homes without council approval
item.description: The dumping of the waste is the latest in a series of similar events for the city which some now call "Australia’s waste capital".

item.title: Shellharbour mayor's quick thinking during call may have saved deputy's life
item.description: A mayor's split-second decision to answer a phone call instead of heading into the surf may well have saved the life of his deputy.
